senses.de: A small part or piece that is shown as proof or to get information about the whole thing it came from.
senses.ex: He took a sample of her blood to be tested in the lab.

Tips.title: Proof of Whole
Tips.description: Understand 'sample' as a part showing quality or features of everything it represents.
Tips.example: The paint sample reflects the color of the entire batch.

Tips.title: Research Context
Tips.description: 'Sample' is often used in scientific or market research contexts.
Tips.example: Scientists examined tissue samples under a microscope.

senses.de: A small amount of a product given to customers to try to see if they like it.
senses.ex: The company is handing out free samples of their new chocolate bar.

Tips.title: Promotional Use
Tips.description: Companies give 'samples' as a promotion to introduce new products to consumers.
Tips.example: I received a shampoo sample in the mail.

Tips.title: Not for Sale
Tips.description: Samples are typically free and not intended for sale; they're a marketing strategy.
Tips.example: At the store, they offered samples, not full-sized products.

senses.de: To taste or try a small amount of something to see what it is like.
senses.ex: We went to a cheese factory and sampled several kinds of cheese.

Tips.title: Taste Experience
Tips.description: 'Sample' as a verb in food/drink contexts involves trying something for its taste.
Tips.example: I sampled each dessert on the menu.

Tips.title: Casual Action
Tips.description: When used as a verb, 'sample' suggests a casual, often enjoyable, experience of trying.
Tips.example: We sampled the local nightlife during our vacation.

senses.de: A group of people or things from a larger group that is studied to learn about the whole group.
senses.ex: The survey was conducted on a sample of 1000 adults.

Tips.title: Research Representation
Tips.description: 'Sample' refers to a selection that accurately represents a larger group for study purposes.
Tips.example: The researcher chose a diverse sample of participants.

Tips.title: Selection Method
Tips.description: Understanding 'sample' includes how it's selected: randomly, by quota, or convenience.
Tips.example: The survey results depend on a well-chosen sample.

senses.de: To use a small part of a sound recording in a new piece of music.
senses.ex: The DJ sampled an old jazz record in his new song.

Tips.title: Creative Reuse
Tips.description: 'Sample' in music involves creatively incorporating existing recordings into new works.
Tips.example: The rapper's track samples a 70s funk melody.

Tips.title: Artistic Context
Tips.description: Music 'samples' can evoke nostalgia or convey a specific atmosphere in a song.
Tips.example: That song samples a famous movie quote.

Demonstration.wordDefinition:
A demonstration is a performance or display intended to show how something works or is done. For example, a science teacher may demonstrate how an experiment is conducted in front of the class.

Demonstrations are usually used to teach or explain something.

In summary, demonstrations are used to teach or explain something, while samples are used to give you an idea or impression of something before you commit to it.

Example.wordDefinition:
Example describes something that is used to show or explain a concept or idea.

It is usually something that represents a typical situation, process or behavior. For example, if you want to show someone how to solve a math problem, you might use an example of a similar problem.

It is usually taken to represent the whole group or population. For example, if you want to know how good a new brand of cookies is, you might give out samples to get an idea of what people think of them.

Example is used to explain a concept or idea, while sample is used to represent part of a larger group.

Illustration.wordDefinition:
Illustration refers to a visual representation or example of something, often used in books, magazines, or other publications to help explain a concept or idea.

For instance, a textbook might feature illustrations of the human body to help students learn about anatomy.

Illustration refers to a visual representation and sample refers to a small portion used to represent a larger whole.

Illustration is often used in publications, while sample is often used in retail settings.

Model.wordDefinition:
A model is a representation of something in order to better understand or predict its behavior.

It is often a simplified version of the real thing used to explain complex ideas or systems. For example, a scientist might create a model of the solar system to better understand how the planets move.

In general, models are used to help understand complex systems or ideas, while samples are used to get an idea of what something is like without having to examine everything.

Prototype.wordDefinition:
A prototype is an initial or preliminary model of something that is developed to test and evaluate its design and functionality before producing the final product.

Prototypes are usually used in the development process of a new product to see if it will work properly and to make any necessary modifications before mass production begins.

A prototype is the first version of something that is made to test its design, while a sample is a small part of a final product that is used to showcase its features and quality.

Specimen.wordDefinition:
A specimen is a single item or thing that is representative of a larger group or category. For example, a biologist might collect a specimen of a plant or animal for scientific study.

In other words, a sample is a smaller piece taken from a larger object, while a specimen is a single object that represents a larger group.

Samples are often used for testing or analysis, while specimens are used for study or observation in scientific fields.

Test.wordDefinition:
Samples are used to gather information about a population without having to survey or test everyone.

A test is an assessment or evaluation of a person, thing, product, or idea.

It is used to determine the quality, effectiveness, or knowledge associated with the item being tested.

A test is normally used to measure the characteristics of a specific item, for example, a product’s durability, the quality of air in the environment or knowledge and ability on a particular subject.

In essence, a sample is used to represent a larger group while a test is a way to measure the characteristics of a single item or person.

Samples are commonly used in research and data collection while tests are typically used in evaluations and assessments.

Trial.wordDefinition:
Trial refers to a formal attempt or test to evaluate something, such as a product, process, or person. Trials are used to determine the effectiveness or suitability of something.

For example, a medication is tested in a clinical trial to determine its safety and efficacy. Trials are applicable in various fields, such as law, science, and medicine.

A sample is a small portion that is taken as a representative of a larger whole, while a trial is a formal test to evaluate something.

Samples are mainly applicable to products or materials, while trials are applicable in various fields.

quotes.Text: This was totally influenced by me and the direction that I am writing about and the stuff that I am writing about. There is just no way that you can be as intense as what I have been through in my life over a drum beat machine, sample, or loop; it's just not going to happen.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Vanilla Ice

quotes.Text: We can detect very small differences in telomere length, and it is a very simple and fast technique where many samples can be analysed at the same time. Most importantly, we are able to determine the presence of dangerous telomeres - those that are very short.

quotes.Name: María Blasco Marhuenda

quotes.Text: I wrote and produced millions and millions of selling records, so my publishing company alone was worth millions of dollars. I didn't have to work anymore in life because when the rappers started sampling... I'm the most sampled artist in history.

quotes.Name: Rick James

quotes.Text: I thinks it really interesting how they throw the world music samples in there. I often wonder what it would be like to do something like that, but use my lyrics and my kind of style.

quotes.Text: All my mates are at university, and it's a life I haven't had a chance to enjoy, so it's great to turn up and sample a bit of it.

quotes.Text: Luther Campbell is the only person that has ever paid me for sampling me. I'm out for the rest of 'em, but the young man paid me.

quotes.Text: The universe extends beyond the mind of man, and is more complex than the small sample one can study.

quotes.Text: You never know what can happen if you get sampled by the biggest artist in the world.

quotes.Text: I've always had a deep passion for a lot of early electronic and sampled music.

quotes.Text: People come from all over the world to sample Jamaican jerk.
